# igplot

This is just a simple wraper around the `base::plot` function to create network plots faster than `igraph`.

## Installation

You can install `igplot` with:

``` r
remotes::install_github("baruuum/igplot")
```

## Example

```{r example}
library(igraph)
library(igplot)
library(knitr)

# make graph
g = erdos.renyi.game(10, .3)

# make the same plot twice
set.seed(42)
tictoc::tic()
pdf("images/plot1.pdf", width = 6, height = 5)
plot(g, layout = layout_with_fr)
dev.off()
tictoc::toc()
set.seed(42)
tictoc::tic()
igplot(
    g, 
    layout = "layout_with_fr", 
    bg = "white", 
    outfile = "images/plot2.pdf",
    width = 6,
    height = 5,
    return_dat = FALSE
)
tictoc::toc()
```

![](images/plot1.pdf)



`igplot` should be faster than `plot.igraph` especially for larger graphs:

```{r fig.show = "hide", cache = TRUE}
g = erdos.renyi.game(5000, .05)
tictoc::tic()
pdf("images/plot1_large.pdf", width = 6, height = 5)
plot(g, layout = layout_with_fr)
dev.off()
tictoc::toc()

tictoc::tic()
igplot(
    g, 
    layout = "layout_with_fr", 
    bg = "white", 
    outfile = "images/plot2_large.pdf",
    width = 6,
    height = 5,
    return_dat = FALSE
)
tictoc::toc()
```
